medium_description_en: Assesses mental impairment in elderly patients.

seo.meta_description_en: The Abbreviated Mental Test (AMT-10) assesses mental impairment in elderly patients.
seo.keywords_en: AMTS, Amt 10, amt, amt-10, abbreviated mental test score, abbreviated mental test

how_to_use.use_case_en: Do you use the Abbreviated Mental Test (AMT-10) and want to contribute your expertise? Join our contributor team!

about.more_info_en:
Interpretation:

AMT-10 Score

Severity of delirium

0-3

Severe cognitive impairment

4-6

Moderate cognitive impairment

>6

No delirium

From Abbreviated Mental Test Score 1993.

Note: Some authors (e.g. Foroughan 2017) suggest a cutoff of 7 for cognitive impairment.

Original/Primary Reference.text: Hodkinson HM. Evaluation of a mental test score for assessment of mental impairment in the elderly. Age Ageing. 1972;1(4):233-8.
Abbreviated Mental Test Score (AMTS). Occas Pap R Coll Gen Pract. 1993;(59):28.

Validation.text: Bonaiuto S, Rocca WA, Lippi A, et al. Study on the validity of the Hodkinson Abbreviated Mental Test Score (AMTS) in detecting dementia of elderly subjects in appignano (Macerata province), Italy. Arch Gerontol Geriatr. 1992;15 Suppl 1:75-85.
Foroughan M, Wahlund LO, Jafari Z, Rahgozar M, Farahani IG, Rashedi V. Validity and reliability of Abbreviated Mental Test Score (AMTS) among older Iranian. Psychogeriatrics. 2017;17(6):460-465.

Piotrowicz K, Romanik W, Skalska A, et al. The comparison of the 1972 Hodkinson's Abbreviated Mental Test Score (AMTS) and its variants in screening for cognitive impairment. Aging Clin Exp Res. 2019;31(4):561-566.

creator_info.about_en: H. M. Hodkinson, MA, DM, FRCP, is a professor of geriatric medicine at the Imperial College School of Medicine in London, UK. Dr. Hodkinson’s primary research is focused on diagnosis of dementia and other mental impairment in elderly patients.
